data.name: Snivy
data.flavorText: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Snivy
data.flavorText: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

data.name: Servine
data.flavorText: They avoid attacks by sinking into the shadows of thick foliage. They retaliate with masterful whipping techniques.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Servine
data.flavorText: They avoid attacks by sinking into the shadows of thick foliage. They retaliate with masterful whipping techniques.

attacks.name: Wring Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Serperior
data.flavorText: They raise their heads to intimidate opponents but only give it their all when fighting a powerful opponent.

attacks.name: Leaf Storm
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Grass Pokémon.

data.name: Serperior
data.flavorText: They raise their heads to intimidate opponents but only give it their all when fighting a powerful opponent.

abilities.name: Royal Heal
abilities.text: At any time between turns, heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leaf Tornado
attacks.text: Move as many Grass Energy attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Simisage
data.flavorText: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Pansage
data.flavorText: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.

data.name: Petilil
data.flavorText: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.

attacks.name: Magical Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage and heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Lilligant
data.flavorText: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect. It withers if a Trainer does not take good care of it.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. This Pokémon is now confused.

attacks.name: Leaf Storm
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Grass Pokémon.

data.name: Maractus
data.flavorText: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Maractus
data.flavorText: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

attacks.name: Constant Rattle
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 10 damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 30 damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 60 damage.

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Sawsbuck
data.flavorText: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck's horns.

attacks.name: Nature Power
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to both your and your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Horn Leech
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Deerling
data.flavorText: The color and scent of their fur changes to match the mountain grass. When they sense hostility, they hide in the grass.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Tepig
data.flavorText: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

data.name: Emboar
data.flavorText: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

attacks.name: Flare Blitz
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Tepig
data.flavorText: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Pignite
data.flavorText: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Pignite
data.flavorText: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Pansear
data.flavorText: When it is angered, the temperature of its head tuft reaches 600° F. It uses its tuft to roast berries.

data.name: Emboar
data.flavorText: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

abilities.name: Inferno Fandango
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Darumaka
data.flavorText: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Simisear
data.flavorText: It loves sweets because they become energy for the fire burning inside its body.

attacks.name: Flame Burst
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Darumaka
data.flavorText: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Darmanitan
data.flavorText: When weakened in battle, it transforms into a stone statue, then it sharpens its mind and fights on mentally.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Reshiram
data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blue Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Oshawott
data.flavorText: The scalchop on its stomach is made from the same elements as claws. It detaches the scalchop for use as a blade.

data.name: Oshawott
data.flavorText: The scalchop on its stomach is made from the same elements as claws. It detaches the scalchop for use as a blade.

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Samurott
data.flavorText: Part of the armor on its anterior legs becomes a giant sword. Its cry alone is enough to intimidate most enemies.

attacks.name: Pike
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Dewott
data.flavorText: Scalchop techniques differ from one Dewott to another. It never neglects maintaining its scalchops.

attacks.name: Aqua Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 10 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Dewott
data.flavorText: Scalchop techniques differ from one Dewott to another. It never neglects maintaining its scalchops.

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Samurott
data.flavorText: Part of the armor on its anterior legs becomes a giant sword. Its cry alone is enough to intimidate most enemies.

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Basculin
data.flavorText: Red and blue Basculin get along so poorly, they'll start fighting instantly. These Pokémon are very hostile.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Panpour
data.flavorText: It does not thrive in dry environments. It keeps itself damp by shooting water stored in its head tuft from its tail.

data.name: Simipour
data.flavorText: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.

attacks.name: Scald
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Swanna
data.flavorText: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

attacks.name: Feather Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, each of this Pokémon's attacks does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Aqua Ring
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Ducklett
data.flavorText: These bird Pokémon are excellent divers. They swim around in the water eating their favorite food—peat moss.

data.name: Alomomola
data.flavorText: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.

data.name: Alomomola
data.flavorText: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Blitzle
data.flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use their flashing manes to communicate with one another.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Zebstrika
data.flavorText: This ill-tempered Pokémon is dangerous because when it's angry, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Blitzle
data.flavorText: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

data.name: Zebstrika
data.flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

attacks.name: Electrispark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Joltik
data.flavorText: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

attacks.name: Stun Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Joltik
data.flavorText: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Galvantula
data.flavorText: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.

attacks.name: Electroweb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Zekrom
data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bolt Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

data.name: Munna
data.flavorText: Munna always float in the air. People whose dreams are eaten by them forget what the dreams had been about.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Musharna
data.flavorText: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Swoobat
data.flavorText: It emits sound waves of various frequencies from its nose, including some powerful enough to destroy rocks.

attacks.name: Attract
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Venipede
data.flavorText: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.

data.name: Whirlipede
data.flavorText: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Woobat
data.flavorText: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

data.name: Solosis
data.flavorText: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they can survive in any environment.

attacks.name: Cell Culture
attacks.text: Search your deck for Solosis and put it into your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Duosion
data.flavorText: When their brains, now divided in two, are thinking the same thought, these Pokémon exhibit their maximum power.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon and heal all damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Reuniclus
data.flavorText: These remarkably intelligent Pokémon fight by controlling arms that can grip with rock-crushing power.

abilities.name: Damage Swap
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Scolipede
data.flavorText: Highly aggressive, it uses the claws near its neck to dig into its opponent and poison them.

attacks.name: Steamroller
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Timburr
data.flavorText: It fights by swinging a piece of timber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle the lumber without difficulty.

data.name: Timburr
data.flavorText: These Pokémon appear at building sites and help out with construction. They always carry squared logs.

data.name: Gurdurr
data.flavorText: They strengthen their bodies by carrying steel beams. They show off their big muscles to their friends.

attacks.name: Bulk Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, each of this Pokémon's attacks does 20 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Throh
data.flavorText: When they encounter foes bigger than themselves, they try to throw them. They always travel in packs of five.

attacks.name: Circle Throw
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Storm Throw
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Sawk
data.flavorText: The sound of Sawk punching boulders and trees can be heard all the way from the mountains where they train.

data.name: Krokorok
data.flavorText: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Sandile
data.flavorText: It moves along below the sand's surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Liepard
data.flavorText: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.

attacks.name: Taunt
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sucker Punch
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Purrloin
data.flavorText: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.

data.name: Scraggy
data.flavorText: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.

data.name: Krookodile
data.flavorText: It can expand the focus of its eyes, enabling it to see objects in the far distance as if it were using binoculars.

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Krookoroll
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Zorua
data.flavorText: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Scrafty
data.flavorText: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. Each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.

attacks.name: Spit Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is also Paralyzed.

data.name: Zoroark
data.flavorText: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Foul Play
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

data.name: Vullaby
data.flavorText: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Mandibuzz
data.flavorText: It makes a nest out of bones it finds. It grabs weakened prey in its talons and hauls it to its nest of bones.

attacks.name: Blindside
attacks.text: Does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Punishment
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Stage 2 Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Klang
data.flavorText: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Gear Grind
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Klink
data.flavorText: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Klinklang
data.flavorText: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.

abilities.name: Shift Gear
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Metal Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gear Grind
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Patrat
data.flavorText: Extremely cautious, they take shifts to maintain a constant watch of their nest. They feel insecure without a lookout.

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Patrat
data.flavorText: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watches for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.

data.name: Watchog
data.flavorText: They make the patterns on their bodies shine in order to threaten predators. Keen eyesight lets them see in the dark.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Lillipup
data.flavorText: It faces strong opponents with great courage. But, when at a disadvantage in a fight, this intelligent Pokémon flees.

attacks.name: Pickup
attacks.text: Put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Lillipup
data.flavorText: The long hair around its face provides an amazing radar that lets it sense subtle changes in its surroundings.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Herdier
data.flavorText: It loyally follows its Trainer's orders. For ages, they have helped Trainers raise Pokémon.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

data.name: Stoutland
data.flavorText: This extremely wise Pokémon excels at rescuing people stranded at sea or in the mountains.

attacks.name: Odor Sleuth
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Pidove
data.flavorText: Each follows its Trainer's orders as best it can, but they sometimes fail to understand complicated commands.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Minccino
data.flavorText: They greet one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.

attacks.name: Tail Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Audino
data.flavorText: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Unfezant
data.flavorText: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females' flying abilities surpass those of the males.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Tranquill
data.flavorText: It can return to its Trainer's location regardless of the distance separating them.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Bouffalant
data.flavorText: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.

attacks.name: Double Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Bouffalant
data.flavorText: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Head Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Cinccino
data.flavorText: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.

attacks.name: Tail Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Energy Search
rules: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Full Heal
rules: Remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: PlusPower
rules: During this turn, your Pokémon's attacks do 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pokédex
rules: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pokémon Communication
rules: Reveal a Pokémon in your hand and put it on top of your deck. If you do, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Potion
rules: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Professor Juniper
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Revive
rules: Put a Basic Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Super Scoop Up
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Reshiram
data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blue Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: This is an extremely rare Pikachu card. You're very lucky to have found it!

attacks.name: Energize
attacks.text: Attach a Lightning Energy from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Zekrom
data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bolt Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.
